result.execSummary:
The defendant Gavin K. Knight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Gavin K. Knight is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Gavin K. Knight was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

supervisions.notes: Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations.

Probation revoked.
Deft is not eligible for expunction.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gavin K. Knight

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Revoked KCJ on 2/27/17
Deft released from custody as to this file only.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney T Young.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes sentence of 59 days jail w/credit for 59 days served; civil judgment entered on outstanding court costs.  Deft is not eligible for expunction.
Atty Toni Young

Screen 77 (CACU-I77C) w/copy of Revocation Order and Warrant; filed by Dept of Corr/Probation&Parole.   Defendant revoked on 2/7/17; to be returned to court for sentencing.  ZERO PAID ON PROBATION - ALL COSTS STILL DUE.
Revocation packet.
At the request of DOC Agt Adam Lucht a SEHR is set for 2/27/17 at 2:30pm.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State's motion to revoke HOA.  Court revokes the hold open agreement and enters judgment on ct 2.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.  Expunction hearing set for 12/8/17 at 8:30am.
With Atty Henry and by agreement of ADA Krejcarek the MH of 10/19/16 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Henry needs more time to prepare for the sentencing; reset to 11/10/16 at 8:30am.
to revoke stipulated hold open agreement; filed by ADA Jessica Krejcarek.
Stipulated Hold Open Agreement -

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court withholds entry of judgment and allows a hold open agreement to go forward.  RH 2/8/17 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henry states the case will be resolved with a DPA.  PLEAH set for 2/8/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
Plea hearing at 01-20-2016 08:30 am
Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henry is out on medical leave.  PLEAH adjourned to 1/20/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henry states the case will resolve w/DPA, paperwork needs to be drawn up.  JS of 11/16/15 at 8:30am changed to a PLEAH.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case is not resolved.  Atty Chavez states that Atty Henry will be taking over this case from him.  JSH 10/29/15 at 1:15pm and JS 11/16/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 9/18/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Chavez.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Chavez reports that an investigation is ongoing, just received a plea offer.  FPT continued to 8/28/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Atty Jeremy Chavez

105pm  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: LE  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court. Defendant requests Jury Trial. DA Pretrial set for 6/12/15 @ 140pm & Judicial Pretrial set for 7/14/15 @ 845am.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk

*No Contact w/ Kylie S or residence
